get.summary: Read configuration of Mesh network topology
get.description: Configuration data for Mesh network topology.

post.summary: Create a new Mesh network  profile

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaMesh_MeshSchema.description: Configuration data for Mesh network topology.

key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

x-enumDescriptions.BAND_TYPE_24GHZ: Configures mesh links to operate in the 2.4 GHz radio band.
x-enumDescriptions.BAND_TYPE_5GHZ: Configures mesh links to operate in the 5 GHz radio band.
x-enumDescriptions.BAND_TYPE_6GHZ: Configures mesh links to operate in the 6 GHz radio band.
x-enumDescriptions.BAND_TYPE_ALL: Configures mesh links to operate in either the 6 GHz radio band or 5 GHz radio band.

band.description: Configures the radio band used for mesh link. When configured, the mesh link is established in the defined radio band.

recovery.description: A function to allow mesh point connection using a backup general configs when configured profile can not establish mesh link

x-enumDescriptions.FULL: Configures both the sub bands of the 5 GHz radio as the mesh link. The radio assignment however depends on factors such as hop count to the mesh portal, availability of neighboring mesh APs, and preferred uplink radio setting of the mesh profile. This is the default setting.
x-enumDescriptions.LOWER: Configures the lower 5 GHz radio as the mesh link.
x-enumDescriptions.UPPER: Configures the upper 5 GHz radio as the mesh link
x-enumDescriptions.FIRST: Configures radio 0 as the mesh link.

split5g-band-range.description: Configures the 5 GHz radio used for the mesh link. Use this command to configure the 5 GHz radio that should be used as the mesh link. This setting only takes effect when split 5 GHz or dual 5 GHz radio is enabled on the AP.

x-enumDescriptions.HIGH: Enables mesh roaming function and RSSI threshold less than or equal to 22
x-enumDescriptions.LOW: Enables mesh roaming function and RSSI threshold less than or equal to 15.

mobility.description: Configures enabled fast roaming on a mesh point

items.description:
Transmission rate at which the AP can transmit data to clients connected on the 5 GHz band. The value is defined in Mbps.
Range: 6,9,12,18,24,36,48,54

max-children.description: Maximum number of mesh children APs that can be connected to the AP.Range: 1-64 Default: 8

heartbeat-threshold.description:
Heartbeat threshold for mesh neighbor APs. The AP will drop connection with the neighboring AP when the missed heartbeat count exceeds the defined threshold.
Range: 1-255  Default: 10

hop-count.description:
Maximum number of hop counts allowed between the AP and the mesh portal. The parent mesh AP will be dynamically selected on the number of number of hop counts allowed.
Range: 1-32  Default: 2

link-threshold.description: Threshold RSSI value below which mesh links incur a metric penalty. Range: 10-90  Default: 12

max-retries.description:
Maximum number of scans the Instant AP performs on a particular channel to identify neighboring mesh APs before moving on to the next channel.
Range: 1-15 Default: 4

mobility-beacon-miss.description:
Number of consecutive missed Beacon frames after which mesh roaming it triggered on the AP. Applies to mesh points with mobility enabled.
Range: 10-25   Default: 16

private-vlan.description: Mesh private VLAN ID for control traffic between a remote mesh portal and mesh node. Range: 0-4094  Default: 0

x-enumDescriptions.BEST_LINK_RSSI: Combine link-RSSI with a node cost based on hop-count alone.
x-enumDescriptions.DISTRIBUTED_TREE_RSSI: Combine link-RSSI with a node cost based on number of children.

metric-algorithm.description: Metric algorithm used for path selection to the mesh portal AP.  Range: distributed-tree-rssi, best-link-rssi  Default: distributed-tree-rssi

optimize-scan-interval.description: Time interval between scans to identify better mesh neighbor APs for topology optimization. The value is defined in hours. Range: 1-100 hours  Default: 24

prefer-uplink-radio.description: The preferred 5 GHz radio for mesh links. Mesh link neighbors identified in this radio band will be prioritized over other neighbors identified in the other radio band. This parameter will only take effect when dual 5 GHz or split 5 GHz radio is enabled on the AP and mesh-split5g-radio-band is set to full.   Range: none, 5g-lower, 5g-upper    Default: none

reselection-mode.description: Reselection mode of operation.  Range: never, subthreshold, startup-subthreshold, anytime   Default: startup-subthreshold

extended-cluster-name.description:
The API is only supported on AOS8 with the per-AP setting. It works in conjunction with the per-AP mesh-cluster-key and supports the following scenarios:
    1.Set up mesh network among standalone APs
    2.Set up Point-to-Point mesh network between two APs, no matter standalone or swarm mode
    3.Set up 16 avaliable mesh clusters (with mesh-cluster list) and as the top priority cluster
For regular scenarios, it is still recommended to use the mesh-cluster list.

extended-cluster-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
extended-cluster-key.description: The API is only supported on AOS8 with the per-AP setting. It works together with the per-AP mesh cluster. For scenarios, refer to the mesh cluster description.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.
